context: The word 'silma' appears to be a form of the Estonian noun 'silm' (eye). It is used in various expressions related to sleeping or closing eyes. From the dictionary definitions, it can mean 'to put eyelids down', 'to close eyes', or 'to get some sleep'. The word serves as an object in these expressions and appears in different cases including genitive singular, partitive singular, and illative singular of 'silm'.
